results.title: Shearing Yaks (Tajik People)
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Explains how the yak herds, which stay high in the mountains, where it is cool, are brought down to the village for shearing. The wool is pounded by men with sticks, spun into yarn and kept until there is enough to make a carpet. Shows the Tajik people shearing yaks.

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”.
This film shows personal interviews between Russell Drysdale and Australian author George Johnston. Their discussions centre on Drysdale’s slowly developing portrait of Johnston and closely examine the values and lifestyle of what Sidney Nolan calls “the most Australian painter”. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Afghanistan, Pushtun people: making felt
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how women of the Pushtun tribe make felt mats for their families and for decorating the hard floor of their black camel-hair tents. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Building a bridge: Tajik
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how, in three days of actual construction, one hundred Tajik men and boys from one village work together to rebuild their hand-construction bridge. No narration.

results.title: Boys' game: Pushtu nomads
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows an ancient game, well-known in Asia, being played by Pushtu boys. Demonstrates the toughness of the young men and the value these tribal people place on physical superiority. Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Get wet
results.creator_credit: Image East and Royal Life Saving Society
results.brief_description: The message of this humorous program featuring Jonathon Coleman is that water can be great fun providing you know how to enjoy it safely. Presents a number of typical scenarios - swimming pool, river and beach.

results.title: Southeast Asia: a culture history
results.creator_credit: Sigma Educational Films and Arthur Niehoff
results.brief_description: Explains the cultures of Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia and Thailand as a blend of indigenous tribal traditions and the high culture of Hindu-Buddhist India. Discusses how former centres of empire stand as testimony to the endurance of Buddhist and Brahman idea systems in Southeast Asia. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Cyclone = Ciclon
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC) and Santiago Alvarez
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film showing the havoc caused by the cyclone which hit the western provinces of Cuba in October, 1963. Reveals the tragic consequences for the poor peasants and also shows the care taken of the injured and the homeless.

results.title: Boys in the age of machines
results.creator_credit: Academy Film Productions, Ronald Mason and Giorgio Mangiamele
results.brief_description: Presents the many opportunities available today in the field of engineering. Shows a typical machine-shop where a young apprentice follows the production of a pattern from the drawing board design to the casting being finished in the dressing shop. Outlines various diploma and degree courses; employment opportunities based on educational qualifications; preliminary subjects required in basic education.
